Early Access Review

A really enjoyable game, this is within the first hour of playing, can't wait to get stuck into it this week! Love RTS games, this one just has such a nice vibe to it!

So the game is pretty well designed, most of the resource gathering is automated with a percentage based system used to distribute the 'workload' between wood cutters and gatherers.

The Game runs at a smooth 60 fps, no frame rate drops at all, very impressive!

It reminds me of age of empires to some degree but it includes elements of Warcraft, with the cannons reminding me of Nod from C&C haha :)

Early Access Review

More infos + videos here: www.tecthor.com/wizardcraft

I played the beta and the early access version a little bit and as an fan of games like Command&Conquer and Warcraft all I can say is: It's a lot of fun!!! If you are into this kind of game you should definetly check out WizardCraft.

You build up your base, towers as defense and your troops/army (actually as many as you like). You can upgrade your base/units with victory points that you have to earn during the battle. The graphics are just cute and the music gives a nice atmosphere to the game. I especially like the map editor where you can create your own battlegrounds and the skirmish mode where you can have a battle session on one of over 50 maps and just focus on your supply chains, building up your army and destroy your enemies (on top of that all kind of parameters are customizable!). Also I love the dragons and the little gandalfs (wizards) that come in different types.

After a couple of hours playing this, it still is fun and I can definetly recommend it!

reviewText:
As a person who grew up with old classic games like Starcraft, Warcraft, Age of Empires and the settlers I was very happy when I saw, that WizardCraft steps into the direction of these games and combines some of their game mechanics in a good way.

In WizardCraft you have to build up a simple economy to be able to train military units and create defences to defend your base against spiders, CPU´s, dark dragons and even against the undead.

The game offers it´s Players 40 missions (Patch 1.04 right now) in which you can choose between the difficulty casual" and "normal". In the first two missions you have a small tutorial in the back which helps you getting started with the game.

The game also has a skirmish mode and a map editor
date: where the Players can build their own maps. On top of it you can send your own created maps to the developer who then can include your map into the "Community maps" tab in the skirmish mode. This makes your map available to all Players
recommended: which is extremely cool in my opinion (note: Only 100 community maps can get included and only 2 maps per map creator).\n\nThe war system is simple: build up your army and destroy your enemies Castle. You have a variety of units
hoursPlayed: which you can throw at your enemy (for example 4 types of wizards; dragons; archers and swordsmen on horses; portable cannons; etc.).\n\nWizardCraft is a singleplayer game
